Shortcuts

torchdata.datapipes.iter.load package¶

Submodules¶

torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.fsspec module¶

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.fsspec.FSSpecFileListerIterDataPipe(root: str, masks: Union[str, List[str]] = '')¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[str]

FSSpecFileListerIterDataPipe.

Iterable DataPipe to list the contents of the directory at the provided root pathname or url, and yields the full pathname or url for each file within the directory.

Args:

root: The root fsspec path directory to list files from masks: Unix style filter string or string list for filtering file name(s)

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.fsspec.FSSpecFileOpenerIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str], mode: str = 'r')¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[typing.Tuple[str, torch.utils.data.datapipes.utils.common.StreamWrapper]]

FSSpecFileOpenerIterDataPipe.

Iterable DataPipe to open files from input datapipe which contains fsspec paths and yields a tuple of pathname and opened file stream.

Args:

source_datapipe: Iterable DataPipe that provides the pathnames or urls mode: An optional string that specifies the mode in which the file is opened (‘r’ by default)

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.fsspec.FSSpecSaverIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[Tuple[Any, Union[bytes, bytearray, str]]], mode: str = 'w', filepath_fn: Optional[Callable] = None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[str]

Iterable DataPipe that takes in a DataPipe of tuples of metadata and data, saves the data to the target path (generated by the filepath_fn and metadata), and yields the resulting fsspec path

Args:

source_datapipe: Iterable DataPipe with tuples of metadata and data mode: Mode in which the file will be opened for write the data (“w” by default) filepath_fn: Function that takes in metadata nad returns the target path of the new file

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.iopath module¶

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.iopath.IoPathFileListerIterDataPipe(root: str, masks: Union[str, List[str]] = '', *, pathmgr=None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[str]

IoPathFileListerIterDataPipe.

Iterable DataPipe to list the contents of the directory at the provided root pathname or url, and yields the full pathname or url for each file within the directory.

Args:

root: The root local filepath or url directory to list files from masks: Unix style filter string or string list for filtering file name(s) pathmgr: Custom iopath PathManager. If not specified, a default PathManager is created.

Note:

Default PathManager currently supports local file path, normal HTTP url and OneDrive url. S3 url is supported only with iopath>=0.1.9.

register_handler(handler, allow_override=False)¶
reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.iopath.IoPathFileOpenerIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str], mode: str = 'r', pathmgr=None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[typing.Tuple[str, torch.utils.data.datapipes.utils.common.StreamWrapper]]

IoPathFileOpenerIterDataPipe.

Iterable DataPipe to open files from input datapipe which contains pathnames or URLs, and yields a tuple of pathname and opened file stream.

Args:

source_datapipe: Iterable DataPipe that provides the pathnames or urls mode: An optional string that specifies the mode in which the file is opened (‘r’ by default) pathmgr: Custom iopath PathManager. If not specified, a default PathManager is created.

Note:

Default PathManager currently supports local file path, normal HTTP url and OneDrive url. S3 url is supported only with iopath>=0.1.9.

register_handler(handler, allow_override=False)¶
reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.iopath.IoPathSaverIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[Tuple[Any, Union[bytes, bytearray, str]]], mode: str = 'w', filepath_fn: Optional[Callable] = None, *, pathmgr=None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[str]

Iterable DataPipe that takes in a DataPipe of tuples of metadata and data, saves the data to the target path (generated by the filepath_fn and metadata), and yields the resulting path by iopath

Args:

source_datapipe: Iterable DataPipe with tuples of metadata and data mode: Mode in which the file will be opened for write the data (“w” by default) filepath_fn: Function that takes in metadata nad returns the target path of the new file pathmgr: Custom iopath PathManager. If not specified, a default PathManager is created.

Note:

Default PathManager currently supports local file path, normal HTTP url and OneDrive url. S3 url is supported only with iopath>=0.1.9.

register_handler(handler, allow_override=False)¶
reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.online module¶

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.online.GDriveReaderDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str], *, timeout: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[typing.Tuple[str, torch.utils.data.datapipes.utils.common.StreamWrapper]]

Iterable DataPipe that takes URLs point at GDrive files, and yields tuples of file name and IO stream.

Args:

source_datapipe: a DataPipe that contains URLs to GDrive files timeout: timeout in seconds for http request

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str]¶
class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.online.HTTPReaderIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str], timeout: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[typing.Tuple[str, torch.utils.data.datapipes.utils.common.StreamWrapper]]

HTTPReaderIterDataPipe

Iterable DataPipe that takes file URLs (http URLs pointing to files), and yields tuples of file URL and IO stream.

Args:

source_datapipe: a DataPipe that contains URLs timeout: timeout in seconds for http request

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

class torchdata.datapipes.iter.load.online.OnlineReaderIterDataPipe(source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str], *, timeout: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: abc.IterDataPipe[typing.Tuple[str, torch.utils.data.datapipes.utils.common.StreamWrapper]]

Class

Iterable DataPipe that takes file URLs (can be http URLs pointing to files or URLs to GDrive files), and yields tuples of file URL and IO stream.

Args:

source_datapipe: a DataPipe that contains URLs timeout: timeout in seconds for http request

reinforce_type(expected_type)¶

Reinforce the type for DataPipe instance. And the ‘expected_type’ is required to be a subtype of the original type hint to restrict the type requirement of DataPipe instance.

source_datapipe: abc.IterDataPipe[str]¶
